snippet: Even as Washington State’s governor last week signed into law a bill intended to stop child sex trafficking, its supporters wondered how effective it would be.
abstract: Groups working to stop underage sex trafficking praise new law in Washington State requiring Web sites that advertise escorts to provide documentation that the escorts are at least 18 years old, even as they warn that such legislation alone will not stop the exploitation of minors.
lead_paragraph: Even as Washington State’s governor last week signed into law a bill intended to stop child sex trafficking, its supporters wondered how effective it would be.

headline.seo: Washington Passes Law to Curb Sex Trafficking
headline.main: Washington Is First State to Take On Escort Sites
headline.print_headline: Washington Is First State To Take On Escort Sites
